page.title: 09WEDGWOOD FACTORY, BARLASTON
page.content: Hand enamelling is another form of decorating. When the plate has been fired they highlight the pattern with colour. It takes two years training. One plate costs around 15 pounds. There are 1700 people working at Barlaston, but there are 7000 people all over the country working for Wedgwoods. Wedgwood chose Barlaston because there was a 500 acre estate for sale and it was near the railway and canal. The wage depends on what people do. Piece workers get about one third more. In Wedgwoods there are about the same number of men as there are women. For people who leave school and want to work at Wedgwoods there is a Youth Training scheme for 200 people. There are Health and Safety teams all around the factory making sure it is safe and pleasant to work in.
